item.title: 印度机场公司 GMR 计划出售 5.79 亿卢比债券
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，GMR 机场有限公司正在考虑出售 500 亿卢比（5.79 亿美元）的本币债券，这可能创下印度第二大私营机场运营商以卢比发行债券的纪录。【原文：GMR Airports Ltd. is considering a 50 billion rupees ($579 million) local-currency bond sale, according to people familiar with the matter, in what could be a record rupee issuance for India’s second-largest private airport operator.】

item.title: 特朗普协议为世界制造业基地带来一丝清朗
item.description: 在经历了数月的不确定性之后，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普最新达成的关税协议正在为全球最大的制造业地区澄清新贸易格局的大致轮廓。【原文：After months of uncertainty, President Donald Trump’s latest tariff deals are providing clarity on the broad contours of a new trade landscape for the world’s biggest manufacturing region.】

item.title: 马来西亚安瓦尔推出帮助解决生活费用上涨问题的计划
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）表示，马来西亚将降低该国最受欢迎的汽油价格，并发放现金以帮助人们应对生活成本。【原文：Malaysia will lower prices of the country’s most popular petrol for its citizens, and also give cash handouts to help people deal with the cost of living, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said.】

item.title: 只有少数几家 Nifty 公司盈利超过预期，投资者乐观情绪减弱
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本央行副行长表示贸易协议达成后不急于加息
item.description: 日本央行副行长内田伸一在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布与日本达成贸易协议后不久发表的讲话中表示，几乎没有必要立即提高基准利率。【原文：Bank of Japan Deputy Governor Shinichi Uchida indicated there’s little immediate need to raise the benchmark interest rate in a speech delivered shortly after US President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with Japan.】

item.title: 日本邮政保险称超长收益率接近峰值
item.description: 日本最大的人寿保险公司之一日本邮政保险公司（Japan Post Insurance Co.【原文：Japan Post Insurance Co., one of the nation’s largest life insurers, said that super-long-term yields are nearing their peak and the company plans to shift holdings from foreign to yen bonds on expectations of a US interest rate cut.】

item.title: 美国加征关税在即，斯里兰卡央行维持关键利率不变
item.description: 斯里兰卡央行维持基准利率不变，因为政策制定者们要在提供额外刺激措施之前衡量与美国贸易谈判的进展情况。【原文：Sri Lanka’s central bank left its benchmark rate unchanged as policymakers gauge the progress of trade negotiations with the US before delivering additional stimulus.】

item.title: 中国黑客利用微软漏洞，美国核能机构遭袭
item.description: 微软公司警告说，中国国家支持的黑客利用其 SharePoint 软件的漏洞入侵全球机构，其中包括负责设计核武器的美国机构。【原文：Microsoft Corp. warned that Chinese state-sponsored hackers are among those exploiting flaws in its SharePoint software to break into institutions globally, with the US agency responsible for designing nuclear weapons now among those breached.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行预计到 2026 年初将再减息三次，与市场同步
item.description: 经济学家预计，到 2026 年初，澳大利亚央行将再降息三次，高于之前的两次，这使他们的前景与货币市场的定价一致。【原文：Economists expect Australia’s central bank will deliver three more interest-rate cuts by early 2026, up from two seen previously, bringing their outlook into line with money market pricing.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国将与日本组建阿拉斯加液化天然气出口合资企业
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，美国和日本即将达成一项协议，共同从阿拉斯加出口液化天然气。【原文：President Donald Trump said the US and Japan are close to a deal to jointly export liquefied natural gas from Alaska, a potential boost for a long-delayed project that’s struggled to gain traction.】

item.title: 分析师称日本贸易协议给市场带来积极惊喜
item.description: 策略师表示，日本与美国达成的贸易协议对投资者来说是一个积极的惊喜，给这个目前饱受政治不确定性困扰的国家带来了一个令人欣喜的好消息。【原文：Japan’s trade deal with the US is a positive surprise for investors, giving a welcome bit of good news to a country currently gripped by political uncertainty, say strategists.】

item.title: 关注美国贸易进展和美联储利率，黄金保持涨势
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布与日本达成一项备受瞩目的贸易协议，标志着在8月1日关税最后期限到来之前的紧张谈判取得了进展，黄金连涨三日。【原文：Gold held a three-day advance, as US President Donald Trump announced a highly-anticipated trade deal with Japan, signaling progress on fraught talks ahead of his Aug. 1 tariff deadline.】

item.title: 芝加哥首席财务官称 2026 年预算方案中可能会增加财产税
item.description: 芝加哥市首席财务官吉尔-贾沃斯基（Jill Jaworski）表示，该市将可能寻求提高财产税，以解决明年的预算赤字问题。【原文：Chicago Chief Financial Officer Jill Jaworski said the city will likely seek to raise property taxes to address next year’s budget deficit.】

item.title: 印尼低等级煤炭进口量下降，中国避而远之
item.description: 上个月，中国煤炭进口量大幅下降，印尼首当其冲，这凸显了由于国内煤炭供应持续过剩，中国发电厂如何转向使用低质燃料。【原文：Indonesia bore the brunt of a sharp fall in China’s coal imports last month, underscoring how Chinese power plants have shifted away from lower-quality fuel due to persistent domestic oversupply.】

item.title: 报道称美国将征收 15%关税，日本汽车制造商股价大涨
item.description: 日本广播协会（NHK）援引一位不愿透露姓名的日本官员的话报道称，美国政府将对从日本进口的汽车征收 15%的关税，随后日本汽车制造商股价大涨。【原文：Japan’s automaker shares surged after broadcaster NHK reported the US government will set 15% tariffs on car imports from the country, citing an unidentified Japanese official.】

item.title: 微软 SharePoint 黑客攻击美国核武器机构
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，微软公司的 SharePoint 文档管理软件被黑客入侵，美国负责维护和设计国家核武器库的机构也在被入侵之列。【原文：The US agency responsible for maintaining and designing the nation’s cache of nuclear weapons was among those breached by a hack of Microsoft Corp.’s SharePoint document management software, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 日本 15%关税协议达成后，日元跳涨并迅速抹去涨幅
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对日本进口商品征收 15%的关税后，日币兑美元汇率飙升了 0.3%，随后又迅速抹去了涨幅。【原文：The Japanese currency spiked as much as 0.3% against the dollar and then quickly erased gains after US President Donald Trump’s announcement of 15% tariffs on Japanese imports.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布征收 15%关税后日本股市攀升
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普宣布与日本达成贸易协议，对日本出口商品征收 15%的关税，低于他之前威胁的 25%，东京股市随之上涨。【原文：Stocks rose in Tokyo after Donald Trump announced a trade deal with Japan imposing 15% tariffs on exports from the country, down from the 25% he had previously threatened.】

item.title: 美日关税谈判协议与金融趋势市场。
item.description: 2025 年 7 月 19 日星期六，日本大阪，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（左）和日本最高关税谈判代表赤泽亮世在大阪世博会美国馆前。日本首相石破茂和贝森特表示，两国可以达成一项 "良好的 "贸易协议，同时表示这一过程可能需要更多时间。【原文：Scott Bessent, US treasury secretary, left, and Ryosei Akazawa, Japan's top tariff negotiator, in front of the US Pavilion at the Osaka Expo in Osaka, Japan, on Saturday, July 19, 2025. Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and Bessent indicated the two nations could reach a “good” trade deal while signaling the process may take more time.】

item.title: 美国贸易谈判进展受关注，石油走高
item.description: 由于投资者关注美国与其主要合作伙伴之间贸易谈判的进展，石油价格走高。【原文：Oil edged higher as investors monitored progress on trade talks between the US and its key partners.】

item.title: 特朗普称已与日本达成协议，关税税率定为 15
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他与日本达成了一项贸易协议，将日本进口商品的关税定为 15%，美国的重要盟友将向美国投资 5500 亿美元。【原文：President Donald Trump said he reached a trade deal with Japan that will set tariffs on Japanese imports at 15% and see the key American ally invest $550 billion into the US.】

item.title: 越南股市因改革希望和对贸易协议的乐观情绪而接近历史纪录
item.description: 在全面政治改革和与美国贸易协议明朗化的乐观情绪推动下，越南股票基准正逼近历史新高。【原文：Vietnam’s stock benchmark is closing in on a record high, fueled by optimism over sweeping political reforms and clarity on a trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 日本汽车制造商提高贷款利率，对家庭造成压力
item.description: 随着央行为解除三十年超宽松货币政策而采取的历史性举措惠及消费者，日本汽车制造商开始提高贷款利率，从而增加了家庭信贷成本。【原文：Japan’s automakers have begun hiking loan rates as a historic central bank pivot to unwind three decades of ultra-loose monetary policy trickles down to consumers, raising household credit costs.】

item.title: Vista 的 KnowBe4 通过直接贷款再融资降低借款成本
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Vista Equity Partners 旗下的互联网安全平台 KnowBe4 Inc.【原文：KnowBe4 Inc., a Vista Equity Partners-owned internet security platform, is cutting its borrowing costs by refinancing about $1.46 billion of private debt through the leveraged-loan market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数纪录保持不变，亚洲交易员情绪乐观：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市开盘以利好为主，美国股市维持在历史高点附近，因为投资者在巨型股财报季之前权衡了关税方面的发展。债券收益率和美元回落。【原文：Asian stocks are set for a mainly positive open, with US equities holding near all-time highs as investors weighed tariff developments ahead of the megacap earnings season. Bond yields and the dollar retreated.】

item.title: NHK 称日本贸易谈判代表即将与特朗普会晤
item.description: 日本公共广播公司（NHK）援引政府消息来源称，日本首席贸易谈判代表赤泽亮世已进入白宫，与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普讨论关税问题。【原文：Japan’s chief trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa has entered the White House to discuss tariffs with US President Donald Trump, public broadcaster NHK said citing government sources.】

item.title: 人工智能脊柱外科公司 Carlsmed 首次公开募股融资 1.005 亿美元
item.description: Carlsmed Inc. 在美国首次公开募股中筹集了 1.005 亿美元，该医疗技术公司的股票定价在市场范围内。【原文：Carlsmed Inc. raised $100.5 million in its US initial public offering, pricing shares in the medical technology company within a marketed range.】

item.title: 亚洲本币债券销售创纪录，美元面临风险
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统难以预测的政策动向推动了投资者对亚洲本币债券的需求，激发了人们对该地区的新兴趣。【原文：President Donald Trump’s unpredictable policy moves are driving investor demand for Asian local-currency bonds, spurring fresh interest in the region.】

item.title: 日元套利交易者从石破茂的选举挫败中看到机会
item.description: 去年一蹶不振的日元利差交易最终可能成为日本大选结果的最大受益者之一。【原文：The yen carry trade that crashed and burned last year may end up being one of the biggest beneficiaries of Japan’s seismic election result.】

item.title: 淡水河谷铁矿石产量因亚马逊矿山表现而上升
item.description: 巴西淡水河谷公司（Vale SA）第二季度的铁矿石产量超出预期，这主要得益于其巴西旗舰矿山创纪录的产量。【原文：Brazil’s Vale SA iron ore production in the second quarter beat estimates, driven by an output record from its flagship mine in Brazil.】
